definition: hard to distinguish real from imitation

sentences.english: In fact I'd guess even the first lady might have trouble telling them apart.
sentences.chinese: 说真的，我猜连第一夫人都可能会真假难辨。

sentences.english: But this distinction will become more difficult as the technology advances.
sentences.chinese: 但是，随着技术的进步将越来越真假难辨。

sentences.english: The artificial rockery showing no artificial trace, is difficult to distinguish between true and false.
sentences.chinese: 而人为的假山不露人工的痕迹，令人真假难辨。

definition: what is true and what is fake
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
can't judge true or false (idiom); unable to distinguish the genuine from the fake/not to know whether to believe (what one reads in the news)
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
lit. to look at flowers in the fog (idiom); fig. blurred vision
hard to tell if it's real or sham
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to counterfeit/to falsify/to cheat/to defraud/fraudulent/to behave affectedly
to counterfeit/to pass off a fake as genuine
